channel.title: Comments on: Dammit people, get to know check constraints and use them!
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Patrick Wood
item.dc:creator: Patrick Wood
item.description: Great article. A Check Constraint is a basic and simple necessity to ensure data validation without writing a single line of code and unlike code it works everywhere throughout an application. Anyone that does not know about Check Contraints is just pretending to be a SQL Server developer.
item.content:encoded: Great article. A Check Constraint is a basic and simple necessity to ensure data validation without writing a single line of code and unlike code it works everywhere throughout an application. Anyone that does not know about Check Contraints is just pretending to be a SQL Server developer.

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.description: I haven't actually ran into having to do something like this, although it's nice to know about it
item.content:encoded: I haven’t actually ran into having to do something like this, although it’s nice to know about it

item.title: By: remou
item.dc:creator: remou
item.description: You can even have check constraints in MS Access! (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa140015(v=office.10).aspx)
item.content:encoded: You can even have check constraints in MS Access! (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa140015(v=office.10).aspx)
